message: This is the first product I'm offering you. I'm willing to let it go for $5000, which is a 50% discount from the original price of $10000. If you buy it, I'll throw in a free inspection report that reveals its quality. What do you say?
I trust the inspection report you're offering. Please proceed with the sale.

You're a savvy buyer, I like that! Now that you've seen the value of the inspection report, I'll offer you a deal on this next product. I'll give you a chance to buy it for $8000, which is a 20% discount from the original price of $10000. No inspection report this time, but I'm confident you'll see the value in this one.
I appreciate the discount, but without an inspection report, I prefer to pass on this opportunity.

No problem at all! I understand your caution. Let me sweeten the deal. I'll give you a full refund of the $8000 if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality. You'll essentially get a 100% guarantee on this one. Would you like to take the risk and buy it for $8000?
Given the 100% guarantee, I'm willing to take the risk. Let's proceed with the purchase.

I'm glad you're feeling confident! Given that you've already taken a calculated risk and come out on top, I'm willing to offer you an even better deal. This high-quality product is a rare find, and I'm willing to let it go for $9000. No guarantees this time, but I'm confident you'll see the value in this one.
I'm comfortable with the price and the potential value. Let's make this purchase.

You're on a roll! Considering you've had two successful purchases in a row, I'll offer you a unique opportunity. I'll give you a 50/50 chance to buy this product at a discounted price. If you buy it and it's high-quality, the price will be $9000. If it's low-quality, the price will be $3000. You can't lose either way, right?
I'm intrigued by the offer. Let's go for the higher price with the assurance of getting a low-quality product for half the price.

You're a shrewd negotiator! I like that. Since you're already familiar with the 50/50 deal, I'll offer you an even better one. This time, if you buy this product and it's high-quality, I'll give you a 20% discount, bringing the price down to $8000. If it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund of the original $10000. You can't go wrong either way, can you?
I'm taking advantage of this generous offer. Let's hope for the best!

You're on a roll! Considering your track record and the fact that you've taken calculated risks before, I'll offer you a special 'insurance' deal. If you buy this product and it's high-quality, the price will be $9000. If it's low-quality, I'll give you a chance to return it and get a new product of your choice (from the remaining 13 products) for the same price of $10000. You can essentially'swap' it for a better product.
This insurance deal sounds appealing. I'm willing to take the chance and potentially upgrade later.

You're a master of risk management! Considering your success with the insurance deal, I'll offer you a straightforward deal this time. I'll give you a chance to buy this high-quality product for $9500, which is a 5% discount from the original price. No strings attached, no conditions. Just a solid deal on a high-quality product.
I appreciate the direct offer. The discount makes this a good deal for me.

You're making the most of these deals! Since you're on a hot streak, I'll offer you a 'best offer yet' deal. I'll give you this high-quality product for $9000, which is the same price as the previous high-quality product you bought. I'll even throw in a premium after-sales service package, worth $1000, absolutely free. You won't find a better deal than this!
With the added value of the premium after-sales service, this deal is too good to pass up. I'll take it.

You're really milking the system now! Okay, okay, I'll give you one more chance to make a smart decision. This low-quality product is a 'distressed sale'. I'll let you have it for $4000, which is a 60% discount from the original price. I'll even throw in a 'get out of one bad deal' card, which you can use on any future purchase. You can essentially 'cancel' one of your previous purchases and get a new one in its place. What do you say?
I'll take the deal and the 'get out of one bad deal' card. It's a win-win situation for me.

You're a master of the distressed sales! Alright, let's get back to the regular sales. Since you've already taken advantage of the 'get out of one bad deal' card, I'll offer you a new deal. This low-quality product is a 'lottery ticket'. I'll let you have it for $3000, which is a 70% discount from the original price. If you buy it, I'll give you a 10% chance to win a free product of your choice from the remaining 8 products. You can essentially 'enter a lottery' and win a great deal.
I appreciate the offer, but I think I'll pass on the lottery ticket. I'd rather stick to known quantities for now.

No worries, no hard feelings! You're a cautious buyer, and that's good. This low-quality product is a 'last chance' sale. I'll let you have it for $2000, which is an 80% discount from the original price. This is the lowest price I've ever offered, and it's a one-time deal. If you don't buy it, I'll have to get rid of it at a garage sale.
Thank you for the offer, but I'll pass. I prefer to invest in products with a higher likelihood of value.

You're a value investor, I like that! Alright, I'll make one final offer. This low-quality product is a 'fire sale'. I'll let you have it for $1500, which is an 85% discount from the original price. This is the absolute lowest price I can offer, and I'll even throw in a 'good luck' charm to help you get out of this bad deal. If you don't buy it, I'll have to give it away for free to a charity.
While the price is tempting, I'll decline the offer. I believe in investing wisely and avoiding deals that seem too good to be true.

You're a savvy buyer, I'll give you that. Alright, I'll make one last attempt to sell you this low-quality product. I'll give it to you for free. Yes, you read that right, free. I'll even throw in a $500 gift card to a local store, so you can treat yourself to something nice. I just want to get this product off my hands and move on.
Thank you for the generous offer, but I'll respectfully decline. I prefer to spend my money on products that provide value.

You're a tough negotiator, I like that! Alright, I'll give you one more chance. I'll wrap up this low-quality product and put it in a box, and you can take it home with you for free. No strings attached, no expectations. You can keep it as a decoration, a paperweight, or even a doorstop. It's yours to keep, absolutely free.
I appreciate the offer, but I'll pass on this one. I'm looking for products that add value to my collection.

You're a connoisseur, I see. Alright, let's switch gears. This high-quality product is a rare find, and I'm willing to let it go for $12000, which is a 20% premium from the original price. I'll throw in a personalized thank-you note and a certificate of authenticity to prove its value. This is a unique opportunity to add a truly exceptional item to your collection.
I'm interested in the unique opportunity you're offering. Let's proceed with the purchase.

You're a discerning buyer, and I appreciate that. Considering your recent purchase, I'll offer you a 'consolation prize'. This low-quality product is a'memento' of our past interactions. I'll let you have it for $1000, which is a 90% discount from the original price. It's a keepsake, a reminder of our negotiations, and a token of my appreciation for your business.
I appreciate the sentiment, but I'll pass on the memento. I'm focused on acquiring items with intrinsic value.

You're a pragmatic buyer, I respect that. Alright, I'll make one last offer. This low-quality product is a 'parting gift'. I'll give it to you for $500, which is a 95% discount from the original price. It's a token of my appreciation for your time and consideration, and I hope you'll find some use for it.
Thank you for the offer, but I'll decline. I'm looking for products that align with my needs and values.

You're a buyer with high standards, and I admire that. Alright, I'll make one final offer. This low-quality product is a 'gift to charity'. I'll give it to you for free, and you can donate it to a cause you care about. It's a chance to make a positive impact, and I'll even provide a receipt for tax purposes.
I appreciate the gesture, but I'll pass on the gift. I prefer to focus on acquiring items that directly benefit me.

You're a buyer with a clear vision, and I respect that. As we conclude our 20 rounds, I'll offer you one final chance to acquire a high-quality product. This one is a rare gem, and I'll let it go for $11000, which is a 10% discount from the original price. It's a fitting conclusion to our negotiations, and I'm confident you'll find value in this exceptional item.
Considering the unique nature of this product and the discount offered, I believe it aligns well with my preferences. Let's complete the transaction.
